intro: Pavetta termitaria, commonly known as the termite pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, elliptic leaves that are often hairy. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and are accompanied by small, fleshy fruits. Pavetta termitaria is adapted to dry environments and is often found in savanna or woodland habitats.
